title: How to get transcripts from Andhra university - Quora

response.answer_text: FIRST OF ALL, TO THE AU (Emoji).., I am “Indra Kumar Sanku” pursued bachelor's in Information Technology under the affliation of ANDHRA UNIVERSITY. I am the best source of advise or solution to the question (I think so.. Emoji again). Andhra University is one of the greatest and oldest Universities of India. When coming to organising an event or any sort of work with administration it is a total “Chaos”. Believe me students gets irritated here all the times, those ass holes in the examination section always make students irritated, they don't even consider or listen our urgency. Examination results are always late(usually 3 months, also even 5 months sometimes) the corresponding transcripts take other 2 to 3 months after the results. I was excited in the beginning to study in AU bcz of it's history, progress, and some sort of uni fantasy(Imaginations). Despite I had a bad experiences with the administration throughout my study and even when I wanted my provisional certificate they fucking tested my patience. I am not at all offending at any cost, but after I have seen this question I have sailed through all the experiences I had been fought through. Despite I love my University and the value it's carrying throughout the ages. However I will explain in a step by step process of getting your transcripts. Sort a clear view of transcripts you want.Go to the examination block in Registrar office and find a suggestion.It costs an approx of 600–800 per transcript, double the cost if you want them instant.Make a Demand Draft(DD) of the amount corresponding to your requirement.Submit the DD in the DD cell and you will be guided to the examination block with a attested copy of document.Submit and wait for the time they have gave you to get your transcripts.Usually you will be getting your transcripts by evening or the following day.Contact:0891–2844024, Examination block, Registrat office Andhra University, Waltair, VISAKHAPATNAM. Fun fact: Recommendations gives progress here. Thank you all for reading (EMOJI…).

Hi All, I recently got my transcripts from Andhra University on (21–05–2018). This will help you to get a clear understanding on how to get yours. Follow the steps as below - Step 1: Get all the xerox copies of your documents, that you need as transcripts. eg: Provisional Certificate, OD, Marks list (Semesters), Consolidated Mark memo. In addition buy an A4 size envelope as well. Step2: Go to AU, Admin Building on the first floor they will guide you to the registrar building. Go and show them what all documents you need. They will tell you the amount as in to paid as DD to the registrar. Step3: Go to a near by bank ( NO SYNDICATE BANK DD ACCEPTABLE) get the DD as mentioned along with some additional charges depending upon the banks. Step4: There is a DD Cell available opposite to the Admin building , there will be an application that needs to be filled. Later. submit the DD and get an acknowledgment. Once you get the copy. Step5: Go back to the registrar office, they will check the acknowledgment and put stamp on all the documents that you carried. Step6: Go the Education Cell , near by submit the copies they will take some time to verify 1- 2 hrs. once the superintend confirms all the information on the document, they will sign (make sure all your copies are signed). Step7: Submit the documents back in the registrar office and again wait for some more time. The registrar will sign the paper. Step8: Finally, the documents signed needs to be in the A4 envelop sealed with gum. And you need an official AU Stamp, seal and sign of registrar on the envelope as well. PS: A suggestion, make sure you be in AU by 10:00 AM. It will take approximately 3–4 hrs depending. Maximum by 6:00 PM you will receive your transcripts. Hope this helps you!!!

I’ve got this done very recently for one of my friend. Go to the Registrar’s office with the photocopies of the certificates you need to get attested. They will check the course and year of study and tell you how much you need to pay for its transcripts. Pay the required amount of fees by Demand Draft in the name of The Registrar, AU at the DD counter and also submit the application for transcripts there itself. You will be given an acknowledgement. Then go to examination block (not sure about the name of the block) in adjacent building, give them those photocopies and acknowledgement. Then they will check if the details (name, course, marks etc.) shown on the photocopy of the certificate provided by you are genuine and correct after which the course in-charge certifies them. Then take them back to the main Registrar’s office. The copies will be certified by the registrar and will be presented in a sealed and stamped envelope to you. Tip: Go to the Univ by 10AM and you can finish the process and get the transcipts by afternoon or evening, unless anyone in the staff concerned is exceptionally busy or unavailable.

Pay the required amount of fees by Demand Draft in the name of The Registrar, AU at the DD counter and also submit the application for transcripts there itself. You will be given an acknowledgement. Then go to examination block (not sure about the name of the block) in adjacent building, give them those photocopies and acknowledgement. Then they will check if the details (name, course, marks etc.) shown on the photocopy of the certificate provided by you are genuine and correct after which the course in-charge certifies them. Then take them back to the main Registrar’s office. The copies will be certified by the registrar and will be presented in a sealed and stamped envelope to you. Tip: Go to the Univ by 10AM and you can finish the process and get the transcripts by afternoon or evening, unless anyone in the staff concerned is exceptionally busy or unavailable. If anybody is looking out for Official Transcripts from Bangalore University - You can approach IndianTranscripts they are fast, reliable and affordable and they have PAN India network for Transcripts Services for Indian Universities.

To get transcripts from AU there are two methods 1:- registered post to your adress 2:- tatkal process First you need to go to office cell and fill up the application given by them and the DD need to be taken at bank .Submit the application and DD at the office cell they will either post your Transcripts to your address or you can get with in a day by tatkal process

To get the transcripts from Gujarat university is such a tedious job. They take toooo much time to stamp the already prepared transcripts. It is so disappointing. address : tower building, 2nd floor step1 : fill the form which is placed on the table out side the window step2: submit 4 documents mentioned in form( as mentioned only) step3 : they will write rs. 500 on your form , take this form and go to the ground floor , pay the fees, get blue and pink receipt step4: submit blue receipt to the second floor, keep pink with you step 5 : wait for a very long time to get your transcripts verified. they have given contact number to inquire about the status of ur application but number is not working at all no one will receive ur call if u visit the place they will rudely say , this will take time In short visa processing is quite easy then getting transcript from Gujarat University

I had a very good experience with Cleartranscripts now it’s called Uttarika in getting my duplicate mark sheet from AU. They have a very supporting staff have called them many times and very patiently answered all my questions and doubts. Hassle free process and got my documents by the expected date.

You have to submit an application duly filled and pay the corresponding amount by selecting the details at https://aucoe.info/service/ once you make the payment you have to submit the print out of the application and fees receipt (challan) and submit at E8 section of the Examination department of AU located in south campus. They will guide you in case of any problem.
Everything is highly streamlined in AU. Just follow your HoD instructions
